studies.title: Tense
studies.objective: This unit defines tenses, differentiates types of tenses and their structures, and distinguishes between present and past participles. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.

studies.title: The Pursuit of Wisdom
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Magnetism
studies.objective: This unit covers magnetic fields, force on current-carrying conductors, torque calculation, magnetic field strength parameters, Biot-Savart law, Ampere's law, and tangent galvanometers. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts and their applications in electrical circuits and measurements.

studies.title: Further on Relation and Function
studies.objective: This unit covers the definitions of relation and function, along with the domain and range of a function. It also explores the concept of the inverse of a relation, different types of functions, and determining the oddness or evenness of a function. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Building a Democratic System
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Chemical Bonding and Intermolecular force
studies.objective:
• To understand the Octet Rule
  • Describe types of chemical bondings and their properties.
  • Definition of lattice energy and how it can be calculated.
  • Polarity.
  • Understanding and being able to draw the Lewis structure of compounds.
  • To understand intermolecular forces.
  • Molecular geometry.
  • To identify the hybridization of orbitals of molecules.
  • Understand highlights about crystals.

studies.title: Human Biology and Health
studies.objective: This lesson covers micro and macro nutrients, digestive health, the respiratory system, cellular respiration, and the circulatory system, including the heart and blood.

studies.title: Micro-Organisms and Disease
studies.objective: This lesson encompasses microorganisms, the immune system, control of microorganisms, prevalent global diseases and their causes, and sexually transmitted diseases (STDs). By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Parts of Speech
studies.objective: This lesson explores the different parts of speech, including their definitions and roles in language. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of the various parts of speech and their significance in sentence construction.

studies.title: Thermodynamics
studies.objective: This unit covers thermodynamics, focusing on the conversion of energy between heat and other forms. Key terms include temperature, kinetic energy, thermal energy, thermal equilibrium, and absolute zero. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts and their applications in thermodynamics.

studies.title: Introduction to Calculus
studies.objective: This unit covers function derivatives and the chain rule, as well as increasing/decreasing functions, critical numbers, and the first derivative test. It also explores definite and indefinite integrals, along with the calculation of areas of regions.

studies.title: Heredity
studies.objective: This lesson explores heredity, chromosomes, genes, DNA, mitosis, meiosis, and Mendelian inheritance. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts.

studies.title: Acid-Base Equilibrium
studies.objective:
• To understand the acid and base concept
  • To identify ionic equilibria  of weak acid and base
  • Describing the concept of the common ion effect
  • Clarifying how to prepare a buffer solution
  • Identify the application of buffer solution
  • The Henderson-Hasselbalch equation
  • Understanding hydrolysis of salts
  • Clarifying acid-base indicator and its color change 
  • Understanding the idea of acid-base titration
  • Examples and uses titration 
  • Equivalents of acid and base

studies.title: Micro-organisms
studies.objective: This Lesson covers protozoa, fungi, bacteria, viruses, the germ theory of disease and Koch's postulates, and the carbon, nitrogen, sulfur, and phosphorus cycles. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Phrase and Clause
studies.objective: This lesson discusses phrases and clauses, including their definitions and usage in sentences. By the end of this lesson, you will have a thorough understanding of phrases and clauses and how they contribute to sentence structure.

studies.title: Justice
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Patriotism
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Physical States of Matter
studies.objective:
• Understand the Kinetic Theory of Matter.
  • Understand the gas laws.
  • The liquid and solid state

studies.title: Sequences and Series
studies.objective: This unit covers finite, infinite, and recursive sequences, arithmetic and geometric series, and their sums. It also discusses convergent and divergent series, as well as applications of arithmetic and geometric progressions.

studies.title: Industriousness
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Biotechnology
studies.objective: This lesson explores the applications of biotechnology, both traditional and contemporary. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of the various uses of biotechnology.

studies.title: Saving
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Chemistry in Industry and Environmental Pollution
studies.objective:
• To define natural resources and industry
  • Understanding the process of production of some important metals
  • To understand the physical and chemical properties of metals
  • Understanding the process of production of some important non-metals
  • To understand the physical and chemical properties of nonmetals
  • To list and describe some industries in Ethiopia

studies.title: Food making and growth in plants
studies.objective: This lesson covers photosynthesis, leaf adaptations, plant transport, seed germination, and plant hormones. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Some Elements in Chemistry and Industry
Rational Expressions and Rational Functions
studies.objective: This unit discusses rational expressions and rational functions, including their definitions and properties. It also covers the decomposition of rational expressions and the graphing of rational functions. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Responsibility
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Self Reliance
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Reading and Writing
studies.objective: This unit explores paragraph formation and structure, including the three basic structures and the identification of topic sentences. It also covers the four types of paragraphs and their descriptions. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Conservation of Natural Resources
studies.objective: This unit explores the conservation of biodiversity, vegetation and wildlife, parks and sanctuaries in Ethiopia, and the topic of global warming. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these subjects.

studies.title: Electrochemistry
studies.objective:
• Define oxidation reduction reaction
  • Conduction of electricity
  • To determine electrolysis of aqueous solution
  • To understand quantitative aspect of electrolysis
  • Describing industrial application of electrolysis
  • To define galvanic(volatile) cell
  • Understanding the definition of batteries and how it works

studies.title: Polymers
studies.objective:
• Introduction to polymer
  • Understanding classification of polymers
  • To describe the process of polymerization
  • Identifying thermoplastic and thermosetting plastics
  • List and identify synthetic polymers
  • List and identify natural polymers

studies.title: Structure of the Atom
studies.objective:
• Dalton Atomic Theory
  • The modern atomic theory
  • Understanding the discovery of The fundamental sub-atomic particles
  • What the atomic models are
  • Understanding the electron configuration

studies.title: Subject and Predicate
studies.objective: This lesson explores the subject and predicate, including their roles and functions in a sentence. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of the subject and predicate components of sentences.

studies.title: Chemical Reactions and Stoichiometry
studies.objective:
• Understand the laws of chemical reactions and equation
  • Balancing chemical equation
  • Grasp the energy changes in chemical reactions
  • Knowing the types of reaction
  • Oxidation-reduction reactions
  • Understanding rates and equilibrium of chemical reactions

studies.title: Further on Trigonometric Functions
studies.objective: This unit discusses the domain, range, amplitude, and period of trigonometric functions. It also explores real-world applications and properties of these functions.

studies.title: Oscillations and waves
studies.objective: This unit covers oscillation, position, equilibrium, restoring force, and simple harmonic motion. It explains the concept of a simple pendulum and a mass-spring system. Additionally, it describes how to calculate the velocity of an oscillating mass.

studies.title: Current Electricity
studies.objective: This unit focuses on electric current and its calculation, electro chemical cells, Ohm's law, factors affecting resistance, electromotive force, and the cost of electric energy. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts and their practical implications in electric circuits and energy consumption.

studies.title: Biology and Technology
studies.objective: This lesson focuses on renowned Ethiopian biologists and their seminal works, which have made significant contributions to the field.

studies.title: Rule of law and Constitution
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Periodic Classification of the Elements
studies.objective:
• To know the historical development of the periodic table
  • To know the classification of elements and their location in the periodic table
  • Periodic properties of elements within a group and across a period
  • Understanding the advantages of the periodic table

studies.title: Cell Biology
studies.objective: This lesson will explore light and electron microscopes, their applications, and the distinctions between plant and animal cells. Additionally, you will grasp the concepts of diffusion, osmosis, and active transport and their importance in cellular processes and maintaining balance.

studies.title: Coordinate Geometry
studies.objective: This unit covers the equations and properties of various conic sections. It includes the equations and properties of straight lines, circles, parabolas, ellipses, and hyperbolas. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these topics, including slope, tangents, centers, radii, vertices, foci, eccentricity, and asymptotes.

studies.title: Statistics And Probability
studies.objective: This unit covers class interval, class mark, and statistical measures (mean, mode, median, range, quartile, decile, percentile, and deviation) for grouped and ungrouped data. It also includes an exploration of permutation and combination.

studies.title: The Set of Complex Number
studies.objective: This unit covers complex numbers and their operations, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. It also explores the conjugate of complex numbers and the polar form representation. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics and their mathematical applications.

studies.title: Energy Transformation
studies.objective: This lesson explores ATP, the aerobic and anaerobic respiration pathways, light-dependent and light-independent reactions in photosynthesis, factors affecting the rate of photosynthesis, and C3 and C4 photosynthesis. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts.

studies.title: Active and Passive Voice
studies.objective: This unit covers active and passive voice distinction, identifying passive voice structures in different tenses, and converting Wh-questions, imperative sentences, and intransitive verbs to passive voice. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Human biology and Health
studies.objective: This lesson focuses on the nervous system, drug abuse, eyes and common eye defects, hearing and other sense organs, the endocrine system, reproductive health, and kidney and liver functions in homeostasis. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid grasp of these topics.

studies.title: Active Community Participation
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Vector
studies.objective: This unit covers the difference between scalar and vector quantities, identification and distinction of vector types, combination and resolution of parallel, perpendicular, and non-parallel/non-perpendicular vectors, as well as the differentiation between scalar (dot) and vector (cross) products.

studies.title: Dynamics
studies.objective: This unit covers contact and non-contact forces, the four basic forces, Newton's laws of motion, friction types, conservation of linear momentum, momentum and impulses, elastic and inelastic collisions, torque and circular motion, center of mass, and momentum conservation in variable mass systems.

studies.title: Mathematical Reasoning
studies.objective: This unit explores the concepts of propositions and open propositions, logical connectives, contradiction and tautology, converse and contra-positive statements, quantifiers, and arguments and validity. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics and their significance in logic and reasoning.

studies.title: Classification
studies.objective: This lesson focuses on the classification of living things, including the 5 Kingdoms, specifically Kingdom Plantae and its classes, as well as Kingdom Animalia and its classes. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts.

studies.title: Matrices and Determinants
studies.objective: This unit covers matrices and their types, as well as operations like addition, subtraction, and multiplication. It also includes concepts such as transpose, determinant, and inverse. Additionally, it explores Cramer's rule and echelon form.

studies.title: Vectors and Transformation of the Plane
studies.objective: This unit covers the magnitude of vectors, properties of vectors including unit vectors, dot product, and transformations such as translation, reflection, and rotation.

studies.title: Introduction to Organic Chemistry
studies.objective:
• To understand saturated hydrocarbon
  • Describing the concept of unsaturated hydrocarbon
  • Understanding cycloalkene Cycloalkyne structure and property
  • Aromatic hydrocarbon
  • Identify benzene derivatives
  • List and clarify a natural source of hydrocarbon
  • To define alcohol and its properties and structure 
  • Understanding the industrial and agricultural applications of organic compound

studies.title: Electrostatics
studies.objective: This unit focuses on electrostatics, including the definition of electrostatics, the law of conservation of charge, Coulomb's law, Gauss's law, and the calculation of electric fields. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts and their applications in understanding electric charges, forces, and fields.

studies.title: Conditional Sentences
studies.objective: This unit covers conditional sentences, their structure, and the concept of inversion in the first, second, and third conditionals. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Sentences
studies.objective: This lesson provides an overview of sentence types, including their classification and characteristics. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of the different types of sentences.

studies.title: Equality
studies.objective: undefined

studies.title: Biochemical Molecules
studies.objective: This lesson covers inorganic molecules, water, carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, nucleic acids, and tests to determine the presence of certain molecules. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.

studies.title: Motion and Sound
studies.objective: This unit defines waves and key terms associated with them. It helps understand and differentiate the two types of waves. It also describes variables related to wave motion and states the four basic properties of wave motion.

studies.title: Enzymes
studies.objective: This lesson explores the properties of enzymes, the naming of enzymes, models of enzyme action, and factors affecting enzyme function. By the end of this lesson, you will have a solid understanding of these concepts.

studies.title: Important Inorganic Compounds
studies.objective:
• Introduction to inorganic compounds
  • Understanding the concept, properties, and structure of oxides
  • Understanding the concept, properties,and structure of acid
  • Identifying concentrated and dilute acid
  • Understanding the concept, property, and structure of the base
  • Identifying concentrated and dilute base
  • To define the concept, property, and structure of salt
  • Identifying plant nutrients and their use

studies.title: Equilibrium
studies.objective: This unit defines the concept of equilibrium and describes the moment of force in relation to equilibrium. It states the two conditions of equilibrium and differentiates between the two types of equilibrium. Additionally, it describes the term "couple" and states its properties.

studies.title: The Science of Biology
studies.objective: This lesson delves into the biotic and abiotic components of ecosystems, food relationships, and the carbon and nitrogen cycles. By the conclusion of this lesson, you will possess a comprehensive understanding of these concepts.

studies.title: Cell Biology
studies.objective: This lesson covers the cell theory, the types of cells, the structure of the cell membrane, active and passive transport, and the functions of cell organelles. By the end of this lesson, you will have a comprehensive understanding of these topics.
